name: Oil Painting Workshop
description: Capture the warmth and texture of fresh lemons perfect for beginners and art lovers alike. Learn step-by-step techniques while creating your own colourful still life painting.

name: Mad Hot Ballet: New Wave

location.name: Four Seasons Centre for the Performing Arts

description:
Dance through time with our bold New Wave theme. Embrace the fearless spirit and creative explosion of the early 80s with vibrant, boundary-pushing fashion and a rebellious energy. 

One of the most highly anticipated evenings on Toronto's social calendar, this performance draws together dance lovers, trendsetters and culture connoisseurs for a one-night-only celebration of ballet – and a healthy dose of fashion. Dress your New Wave best and be prepared to spin right round and burn down the house for our most important fundraising event. This show aims to raise $1 million for these vital initiatives in just one unforgettable evening!

name: Windfields Park Tree Planting Event
description:
Join us at Windfields Park to plant native trees and shrubs to help increase local biodiversity and create valuable wildlife habitat!

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: Dancing in the Park

location.name: Edwards Gardens (On the lawn behind the barn)

description: Scottish Country Dancing to live music on the lawn. We dance easy jigs, reels and strathspeys including audience participation dances. No experience is needed to join in and you do not need a partner. Come and enjoy the fun. It's great exercise and a lovely social.

name: Community Environment Day at Albion Mall
description:
Join Councillor Crisanti (Ward 1) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Dim Sum Mondays at aKin
description:
A hands-on workshop and dinner event where you get to try your hand in a professional kitchen at making Dim Sum favourites like Siu Mai and Har Gow. 

Chef Eric will guide you through the secrets, tips and tricks in this special experience that begins with a welcome drink followed by an hour-long tutorial, and a three-course dinner with drinks. End the night with take-home hand-made Dim Sum.

name: Tuesday Night Swing Dance and Big Fam Jam
description:
Join us and dance with an invigorating live band. Tables will be cleared so there will be plenty of space for your moves!

The Big Fam Jam is a weekly open jam hosted by Jackson Steinwall, designed to bring together musicians of all backgrounds and skill levels to celebrate the joy of making music. Whether you're an instrumentalist, vocalist, or just a lover of live music, this welcoming space invites everyone to join in.

name: I Heart Market Street Music Series

location.name: Market Street north of the Esplanade

description: Enjoy midday and evening performances from a selection of Toronto musicians.

name: imagineNATIVE Film and Media Arts Festival
description:
Visit the world's largest Indigenous film festival, celebrating its 25th anniversary! Featuring screenings of Indigenous-made films, a free digital and interactive arcade, art exhibitions, industry workshops, DJ dance parties, and more. 

There's something for everyone, and everyone is welcome at this world-class celebration of Indigenous artistic excellence.

name: Oak Tree | Human - MFA Art Exhibit by Lisa Murzin
description:
A contemplation through time and space to communicate with the two-hundred-year-old tree that lives in front of Lisa Murzin's home - a relationship that is embodied in a visual and auditory experience, through photography and video installation.

Imagine a tree speaks to you through sonic or bodily sensations and the conversation you might have together.  Then consider, as the earth continues to be altered by human activity, how a friend-like relationship would affect our perception of trees and advocacy for their agency and protection.
